values.title: SSH WARNING: REMOTE HOST IDENTIFICATION HAS CHANGED!

content.raw:
launching Gazebo:

Running the following command:

at NOW <start_ros.sh

ret: True

err: @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @
WARNING: REMOTE HOST IDENTIFICATION HAS CHANGED! @
@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ IT IS
POSSIBLE THAT SOMEONE IS DOING SOMETHING NASTY! Someone could be
eavesdropping on you right now (man-in-the-middle attack)! It is also
possible that a host key has just been changed. The fingerprint for
the ECDSA key sent by the remote host is
eb:3b:3a:d5:bf:ec:ee:6d:9d:50:3f:db:b4:de:e8:4d. Please contact your
system administrator. Add correct host key in
/var/www/.ssh/known_hosts to get rid of this message. Offending ECDSA
key in /var/www/.ssh/known_hosts:1 remove with: ssh-keygen -f
"/var/www/.ssh/known_hosts" -R ec2-50-19-0-175.compute-1.amazonaws.com
Password authentication is disabled to avoid man-in-the-middle
attacks. Keyboard-interactive authentication is disabled to avoid
man-in-the-middle attacks. warning: commands will be executed using
/bin/sh job 1 at Tue Oct 9 21:04:00 2012
content.html:
launching Gazebo:

Running the following command:

at NOW <start_ros.sh

ret: True

err: @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @ WARNING: REMOTE HOST IDENTIFICATION HAS CHANGED! @ @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ IT IS POSSIBLE THAT SOMEONE IS DOING SOMETHING NASTY! Someone could be eavesdropping on you right now (man-in-the-middle attack)! It is also possible that a host key has just been changed. The fingerprint for the ECDSA key sent by the remote host is eb:3b:3a:d5:bf:ec:ee:6d:9d:50:3f:db:b4:de:e8:4d. Please contact your system administrator. Add correct host key in /var/www/.ssh/known_hosts to get rid of this message. Offending ECDSA key in /var/www/.ssh/known_hosts:1 remove with: ssh-keygen -f "/var/www/.ssh/known_hosts" -R ec2-50-19-0-175.compute-1.amazonaws.com Password authentication is disabled to avoid man-in-the-middle attacks. Keyboard-interactive authentication is disabled to avoid man-in-the-middle attacks. warning: commands will be executed using /bin/sh job 1 at Tue Oct 9 21:04:00 2012

values.title: Prototype tool to adaptively induce latency

content.raw:
For the VRC, we want to be as fair as possible to teams, independent of their geographic location.  One way to do this is to vary the amount of additional latency that gets injected between the team's OCU and their team code machine based on the intrinsic latency between the OCU and the cloud, specifically, the traffic shaping machine that's doing the latency injection via tc.  At the traffic shaper, measure the intrinsic OCU/cloud latency and only add the additional latency required to reach the desired latency.

This ticket asks for a prototype / proof of concept of such a tool.

In an ideal world, we would also be able to modulate packet loss in the same way, based on the intrinsic packet loss.  That might be harder.  In any case, let's start with latency.
content.html:
For the VRC, we want to be as fair as possible to teams, independent of their geographic location. One way to do this is to vary the amount of additional latency that gets injected between the team's OCU and their team code machine based on the intrinsic latency between the OCU and the cloud, specifically, the traffic shaping machine that's doing the latency injection via tc. At the traffic shaper, measure the intrinsic OCU/cloud latency and only add the additional latency required to reach the desired latency.

This ticket asks for a prototype / proof of concept of such a tool.

In an ideal world, we would also be able to modulate packet loss in the same way, based on the intrinsic packet loss. That might be harder. In any case, let's start with latency.

content.raw: Test result files are currently being produced with unpredictable names that include timestamps.  Need to make those names predictable (but still unique) and then enable checking for them.
content.html: Test result files are currently being produced with unpredictable names that include timestamps. Need to make those names predictable (but still unique) and then enable checking for them.

values.title: Check return code and report error output from all subprocess calls

content.raw:
Anywhere that we call a subprocess via commands.*, we should be checking the return code and in the case that non-zero is returned, printing to console both stdout and stderr from the subprocess.  Otherwise, it's difficult to understand what's going wrong.

As a side note, we should transition from the deprecated commands module to the newer subprocess module.
content.html:
Anywhere that we call a subprocess via commands.*, we should be checking the return code and in the case that non-zero is returned, printing to console both stdout and stderr from the subprocess. Otherwise, it's difficult to understand what's going wrong.

As a side note, we should transition from the deprecated commands module to the newer subprocess module.

values.title: GPU machines can be in a bad state

content.raw:
Sometimes, it seems that a GPU-equipped machine boots up in a bad state, wherein GL applications run badly or not at all.  Symptoms include:

 * glxgears returns wildly varying frame rates
 * gzserver never completes its setup, getting stuck in the first call that it makes to GL

Rebooting the machine seems to fix it.

I'm attaching a tarball of /var/log from a machine that was in the bad state then was rebooted into the good state (the logs were grabbed when in the good state).  We should do the same (get logs) for a machine in the bad state.
content.html:
Sometimes, it seems that a GPU-equipped machine boots up in a bad state, wherein GL applications run badly or not at all. Symptoms include:

  • glxgears returns wildly varying frame rates
  • gzserver never completes its setup, getting stuck in the first call that it makes to GL

Rebooting the machine seems to fix it.

I'm attaching a tarball of /var/log from a machine that was in the bad state then was rebooted into the good state (the logs were grabbed when in the good state). We should do the same (get logs) for a machine in the bad state.

content.raw:
Feature request from the DRC Forum:

"Can we get an ntp/ptp server operating on the simulation computer that the field and OCS computers can sync to?
Can we add wall clock to the API clock message? 

Together, these will allow us to keep track of the delay between time stamped messages and the time on receiving computer.
On the actual system it would make more sense to have the robot sync to the OCS (assuming it has GPS/internet time server connection), but may be simpler to have the simulation cloud provide service here."
content.html:
Feature request from the DRC Forum:

"Can we get an ntp/ptp server operating on the simulation computer that the field and OCS computers can sync to? Can we add wall clock to the API clock message?

Together, these will allow us to keep track of the delay between time stamped messages and the time on receiving computer. On the actual system it would make more sense to have the robot sync to the OCS (assuming it has GPS/internet time server connection), but may be simpler to have the simulation cloud provide service here."

values.title: Difficult to add new constellation configuration

content.raw:
Adding a new constellation type should be as easy as adding a python file that contains:
* The plugin methods (launch, terminate, monitor, start/stop sim)
* the description of the constellation (for the launch selection menu)
* the constellation machine and widget layout (seen in your browser)

At the moment, 
* the plugins are in the cloudsimd daemon, 
* the description is in inside/cgi-bin/common/machine_configuration.py 
* the widget layout is in cloudsim.js
content.html:
Adding a new constellation type should be as easy as adding a python file that contains: The plugin methods (launch, terminate, monitor, start/stop sim) the description of the constellation (for the launch selection menu) * the constellation machine and widget layout (seen in your browser)

At the moment, the plugins are in the cloudsimd daemon, the description is in inside/cgi-bin/common/machine_configuration.py * the widget layout is in cloudsim.js

content.raw:
Using cloudsim-prerelease 1.2.7 with the simulator_prerelease configuration, my start_sim.bash on the simulator machine has this content:

    echo date "  " >> /home/ubuntu/cloudsim/start_sim.log

    . /usr/share/drcsim/setup.sh
    export ROS_IP= 10.0.0.51
    export GAZEBO_IP= 10.0.0.51
    export DISPLAY=:0
    roslaunch   
    gzname:=gzserver   &

Should be using the server-side OpenVPN address (should be 11.8.0.1).

Also the roslaunch line is mangled, probably from bad substitution in generating the script.

Also /etc/openvpn/openvpn.conf on the simulator machine has the wrong address configuration.  It's giving itself 11.8.0.2, which should be the client's address.

Also the security group generated for this machine doesn't allow UDP traffic over 1194, needed for OpenVPN to work.

Also, the GAZEBO_IP and GAZEBO_MASTER_URI should be uncommented in the client-side ros.bash file.

With all of those changes, I was able to run both rviz and gzclient, talking to the remove simulation instance.
content.html:
Using cloudsim-prerelease 1.2.7 with the simulator_prerelease configuration, my start_sim.bash on the simulator machine has this content:

echo date "  " >> /home/ubuntu/cloudsim/start_sim.log

. /usr/share/drcsim/setup.sh
export ROS_IP= 10.0.0.51
export GAZEBO_IP= 10.0.0.51
export DISPLAY=:0
roslaunch   
gzname:=gzserver   &

Should be using the server-side OpenVPN address (should be 11.8.0.1).

Also the roslaunch line is mangled, probably from bad substitution in generating the script.

Also /etc/openvpn/openvpn.conf on the simulator machine has the wrong address configuration. It's giving itself 11.8.0.2, which should be the client's address.

Also the security group generated for this machine doesn't allow UDP traffic over 1194, needed for OpenVPN to work.

Also, the GAZEBO_IP and GAZEBO_MASTER_URI should be uncommented in the client-side ros.bash file.

With all of those changes, I was able to run both rviz and gzclient, talking to the remove simulation instance.

values.title: Automatic termination in case of failed launches

content.raw:
When a constellation fails to launch, some AWS resources are not released automatically.

This can happen for a variety of reasons:
* instance capacity limits at AWS
* instance limits in the account (for machine types)
* other limits (nb of VPCs, elastic Ips, ...)

Running the terminate automatically works, but it publishes messages that hide the problem. A "silent" terminate should be implemented, or error messages could be placed somewhere.
content.html:
When a constellation fails to launch, some AWS resources are not released automatically.

This can happen for a variety of reasons: instance capacity limits at AWS instance limits in the account (for machine types) * other limits (nb of VPCs, elastic Ips, ...)

Running the terminate automatically works, but it publishes messages that hide the problem. A "silent" terminate should be implemented, or error messages could be placed somewhere.

values.title: Naming convention for the machines in the cloud

content.raw:
I am just wondering if the names are properly chosen. Currently, we can start using cloudsim:

* simulator
* vpc_trio
* vpc_micro_trio
* cloudsim

As far as I now we are just launching a set of machines with our software but we are not launching specific programs from here (this is done later). I believe it might clarify if we rename the names to match the current configuration of the constellation. Specifically, I propose to change 'simulator' by vpc_single or something similar that shows there is only one machine. Maybe in the future we do not run a simulator within this machine.
content.html:
I am just wondering if the names are properly chosen. Currently, we can start using cloudsim:

  • simulator
  • vpc_trio
  • vpc_micro_trio
  • cloudsim

As far as I now we are just launching a set of machines with our software but we are not launching specific programs from here (this is done later). I believe it might clarify if we rename the names to match the current configuration of the constellation. Specifically, I propose to change 'simulator' by vpc_single or something similar that shows there is only one machine. Maybe in the future we do not run a simulator within this machine.

content.raw:
The monitoring of GL state is not reliable on some machines: the messages alternates between

```
#!python

X and GL state: Not running
```
and

```
#!python

X and GL state: running
```

The affected machine's hability to run Gazebo does not seem hampered.


This seems to happen more often on "simulator" constellations than "VPC trio"

A possible fix: increase the timeout value?

This seems to happen more often on "simulator" constellations than "VPC trio"

content.raw:
a.       That the system do not responded as expected. For example, after adding an administrator the name do not appear in the list. Only after logging off and logging in the new name appear in the list.

b.      After some time , the added users/administrators disappear from the list and it is necessary to reenter them again.

c.       Amazon Keys are not always accepted and it's not possible to be sure which resources it is using.
content.html:
a. That the system do not responded as expected. For example, after adding an administrator the name do not appear in the list. Only after logging off and logging in the new name appear in the list.

b. After some time , the added users/administrators disappear from the list and it is necessary to reenter them again.

c. Amazon Keys are not always accepted and it's not possible to be sure which resources it is using.

values.title: Collect system state in key-value store instead of pub/sub

content.raw:
At the moment, some system state is only contained in pub/sub redis messages, which are ephemeral.  All state should be collected in the key-value store, so that any client can access that state at any time.  The issue can be seen in certain startup states, wherein the browser that launched a constellation can see the widgets for the launching machines, but a fresh browser window won't see anything until some state change that generates a message.  

And it can happen in failed launch situations that no messages are generated, meaning that only the original browser window can be used to terminate the constellation.  In that situation the workaround is to go into the AWS console and clean up manually.
content.html:
At the moment, some system state is only contained in pub/sub redis messages, which are ephemeral. All state should be collected in the key-value store, so that any client can access that state at any time. The issue can be seen in certain startup states, wherein the browser that launched a constellation can see the widgets for the launching machines, but a fresh browser window won't see anything until some state change that generates a message.

And it can happen in failed launch situations that no messages are generated, meaning that only the original browser window can be used to terminate the constellation. In that situation the workaround is to go into the AWS console and clean up manually.

values.title: Cloudsim tests not working on Jenkins

content.raw:
There are three errors:

1. In Test command: "inside/cgi-bin/common/startup_script_builder.py": 'inside/cgi-bin/common/startup_script_builder.py' does not exist

2. In Test command:  "cloudsimd/launchers/cloudsim.py": 
   File "cloudsimd/launchers/cloudsim.py", line 343, in launch
   File "/var/lib/jenkins/jobs/cloudsim-cloudsim_1.2-devel-precise-amd64/workspace/cloudsim/cloudsimd/launchers/launch_utils/sshclient.py", line 63, in upload_file
     raise SshClientException('scp failed: %s'%(output))
    SshClientException: scp failed: /var/www-cloudsim-auth/cloudsim.zip: No such file or directory

3. In Test command: /usr/bin/python "cloudsimd/cloudsimd_test.py":
  can't open file 'cloudsimd/cloudsimd_test.py'

It seems that two of the tests no longer exists and one of them has to be fixed.
content.html:
There are three errors:

  1. In Test command: "inside/cgi-bin/common/startup_script_builder.py": 'inside/cgi-bin/common/startup_script_builder.py' does not exist

  2. In Test command: "cloudsimd/launchers/cloudsim.py": File "cloudsimd/launchers/cloudsim.py", line 343, in launch File "/var/lib/jenkins/jobs/cloudsim-cloudsim_1.2-devel-precise-amd64/workspace/cloudsim/cloudsimd/launchers/launch_utils/sshclient.py", line 63, in upload_file raise SshClientException('scp failed: %s'%(output)) SshClientException: scp failed: /var/www-cloudsim-auth/cloudsim.zip: No such file or directory

  3. In Test command: /usr/bin/python "cloudsimd/cloudsimd_test.py": can't open file 'cloudsimd/cloudsimd_test.py'

It seems that two of the tests no longer exists and one of them has to be fixed.

values.title: gzclient causes crashes of master - Might be issue unrelated to cloudsim

content.raw:
I don't know if this bug is related to cloudsim.

Run configuration trio.
Run atlas simulation (launched via console).
everything is ok with simulator computer, field computer and local vpn connected computer: run rviz ok and rzgraph also.

As soon as running gzclient, everything crashes:

the field computer lost connection to master, the local VPN computer as well, so I guess that the master has crashed on the simulator computer.

Error [InsertModelWidget.cc:252] model.config file is missing in directory["/usr/local/share/drcsim-1.3/models/test"]
Qt has caught an exception thrown from an event handler. Throwing
exceptions from an event handler is not supported in Qt. You must
reimplement QApplication::notify() and catch all exceptions there.

terminate called after throwing an instance of 'Ogre::ItemIdentityException'
  what():  OGRE EXCEPTION(5:ItemIdentityException): Can not find codec for 'png' image format.
There are no formats supported (no codecs registered). in Codec::getCodec at /build/buildd/ogre-1.7.4/OgreMain/src/OgreCodec.cpp (line 69)
content.html:
I don't know if this bug is related to cloudsim.

Run configuration trio. Run atlas simulation (launched via console). everything is ok with simulator computer, field computer and local vpn connected computer: run rviz ok and rzgraph also.

As soon as running gzclient, everything crashes:

the field computer lost connection to master, the local VPN computer as well, so I guess that the master has crashed on the simulator computer.

Error [InsertModelWidget.cc:252] model.config file is missing in directory["/usr/local/share/drcsim-1.3/models/test"] Qt has caught an exception thrown from an event handler. Throwing exceptions from an event handler is not supported in Qt. You must reimplement QApplication::notify() and catch all exceptions there.

terminate called after throwing an instance of 'Ogre::ItemIdentityException' what(): OGRE EXCEPTION(5:ItemIdentityException): Can not find codec for 'png' image format. There are no formats supported (no codecs registered). in Codec::getCodec at /build/buildd/ogre-1.7.4/OgreMain/src/OgreCodec.cpp (line 69)

content.raw:
The cloudsim/inside/cgi-bin/common module is used both in the cgi scripts and the cloudsim daemon. 

This is a leftover from a previous design. The shared state should be moved to redis so that the daemon can become independent.

Current shared state left over in common:
* boto file path
* aws credentials helper class
* configurations database 

common also contains web.py that should be taken out.
The redis state should also be name spaced to avoid clashes with other applications.
content.html:
The cloudsim/inside/cgi-bin/common module is used both in the cgi scripts and the cloudsim daemon.

This is a leftover from a previous design. The shared state should be moved to redis so that the daemon can become independent.

Current shared state left over in common: boto file path aws credentials helper class * configurations database

common also contains web.py that should be taken out. The redis state should also be name spaced to avoid clashes with other applications.

values.title: Create a task interface for Constellations

content.raw:
Constellations could have a list of tasks:

 * A task can have a sub task for each category (simulation, traffic shaping, ...)
 * the sub tasks use the the launchers interface 
 * tasks can be created from UI or REST call
 * on task can be active at a time
 * the simulator can interact with tasks (ex: VRC task timeout)
content.html:
Constellations could have a list of tasks:

  • A task can have a sub task for each category (simulation, traffic shaping, ...)
  • the sub tasks use the the launchers interface
  • tasks can be created from UI or REST call
  • on task can be active at a time
  • the simulator can interact with tasks (ex: VRC task timeout)

We need at least a "contestant" user that has limited privileges:
* Can't get all keys
* Can't launch or terminate constellations
* Can't see the packages and launch files
* Can't create or delete tasks

values.title: Next version of cloudsim should include a feature "upgrade"

content.raw:
Next version of cloudsim should include a feature "upgrade" that would allow keeping the previous constellation and not have to launch a new one.
We need to install several packages and then check that everything is compiling and running on the field computer and it would be very annoying to have to re-do it in order to benefit of the new version of cloudsim.
content.html: Next version of cloudsim should include a feature "upgrade" that would allow keeping the previous constellation and not have to launch a new one. We need to install several packages and then check that everything is compiling and running on the field computer and it would be very annoying to have to re-do it in order to benefit of the new version of cloudsim.

values.title: ROS Network is not working properly from the field computer to the local computer

content.raw:
Hi,
We have the following configuration: a named "C11_Agent" running in the field computer and a named "c11" node running on a local computer.
The two nodes communicate with ROS.
However, if the communication from the local  to the field computer is working well and smooth, the communication from the field computer to the local has a problem. 
For example, on the field computer:

~~~
ubuntu@ip-10-0-0-52:~/integrator/robil/C0_Scripts$ rosnode info /c11
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Node [/c11]
Publications:
 * /rosout [rosgraph_msgs/Log]

Subscriptions:
 * /clock [rosgraph_msgs/Clock]

Services:
 * /C11/push_img
 * /C11
 * /c11/get_loggers
 * /c11/set_logger_level
 * /C11/push_occupancy_grid


**contacting node http://localhost:49821/ ...
ERROR: Communication with node[http://localhost:49821/] failed!**
~~~

For sure, it shouldn't be local node but the node with ip 11.8.0.2.

I have no problem on the local computer accessing the ROS nodes running on field computer. 
We are running the trio constellation with all our nodes on the field computer apart of this specific node that needs to be on the local computer.
content.html:
Hi, We have the following configuration: a named "C11_Agent" running in the field computer and a named "c11" node running on a local computer. The two nodes communicate with ROS. However, if the communication from the local to the field computer is working well and smooth, the communication from the field computer to the local has a problem. For example, on the field computer:

ubuntu@ip-10-0-0-52:~/integrator/robil/C0_Scripts$ rosnode info /c11
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Node [/c11]
Publications:
 * /rosout [rosgraph_msgs/Log]

Subscriptions:
 * /clock [rosgraph_msgs/Clock]

Services:
 * /C11/push_img
 * /C11
 * /c11/get_loggers
 * /c11/set_logger_level
 * /C11/push_occupancy_grid


**contacting node http://localhost:49821/ ...
ERROR: Communication with node[http://localhost:49821/] failed!**

For sure, it shouldn't be local node but the node with ip 11.8.0.2.

I have no problem on the local computer accessing the ROS nodes running on field computer. We are running the trio constellation with all our nodes on the field computer apart of this specific node that needs to be on the local computer.

content.raw:
On any simulation machine, the following lines (or similar, depending on network configuration) should be added at the end of `~/.bashrc`, to aid in manual testing (this setting already happens in the start/stop scripts that the web interface uses):

    export GAZEBO_IP=11.8.0.1
    export ROS_IP=11.8.0.1
content.html:
On any simulation machine, the following lines (or similar, depending on network configuration) should be added at the end of ~/.bashrc, to aid in manual testing (this setting already happens in the start/stop scripts that the web interface uses):

export GAZEBO_IP=11.8.0.1
export ROS_IP=11.8.0.1

content.raw:
Cloudsim's monitoring of GL status is disrupting Gazebo's perfomance.  Specifically, running `glxinfo` is playing havoc with Gazebo's reported performance.

Workaround for now: ssh into cloudsim machine and stop the cloudsimd:

    sudo stop cloudsimd

Should reconsider using `glxinfo` as a periodic monitoring tool.  Perhaps just run until the machine is in a state where X is up, then stop doing it.  We don't expect a machine to exit the X-is-up state except when shutting down.

A fix for this bug is a good candidate to be backported into 2.0.x, unless there's a 2.1.0 release coming very soon.
content.html:
Cloudsim's monitoring of GL status is disrupting Gazebo's perfomance. Specifically, running glxinfo is playing havoc with Gazebo's reported performance.

Workaround for now: ssh into cloudsim machine and stop the cloudsimd:

sudo stop cloudsimd

Should reconsider using glxinfo as a periodic monitoring tool. Perhaps just run until the machine is in a state where X is up, then stop doing it. We don't expect a machine to exit the X-is-up state except when shutting down.

A fix for this bug is a good candidate to be backported into 2.0.x, unless there's a 2.1.0 release coming very soon.

values.title: EC2 instances have insufficient disk space

content.raw:
You must create a block device mapping first:

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13585857/how-to-launch-ec2-instance-with-boto-specifying-size-of-ebs

dev_sda1 = boto.ec2.blockdevicemapping.EBSBlockDeviceType()
dev_sda1.size = 50 # size in Gigabytes
bdm = boto.ec2.blockdevicemapping.BlockDeviceMapping()
bdm['/dev/sda1'] = dev_sda1 
After this you can give the block device map in your run_instances call:

reservation = ec2.run_instances( image_id=AMI_ID, 
                                 key_name=EC2_KEY_HANDLE, 
                                 instance_type=INSTANCE_TYPE,
                                 security_groups = [ SECGROUP_HANDLE, ],
                                 block_device_map = bdm)
content.html:
You must create a block device mapping first:

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13585857/how-to-launch-ec2-instance-with-boto-specifying-size-of-ebs

dev_sda1 = boto.ec2.blockdevicemapping.EBSBlockDeviceType() dev_sda1.size = 50 # size in Gigabytes bdm = boto.ec2.blockdevicemapping.BlockDeviceMapping() bdm['/dev/sda1'] = dev_sda1 After this you can give the block device map in your run_instances call:

reservation = ec2.run_instances( image_id=AMI_ID, key_name=EC2_KEY_HANDLE, instance_type=INSTANCE_TYPE, security_groups = [ SECGROUP_HANDLE, ], block_device_map = bdm)

content.raw:
I had the following error when trying to launch a new CloudSim machine, using cloudsim-1.2.0 (private details removed from command line):

    $ ./cloudsim-1.2.0/bin/create_cloudsim.py <address> <key> <secret-key> <zone>
    ./cloudsim-1.2.0/inside/cgi-bin
    ./cloudsim-1.2.0/cloudsimd/launchers
    ./cloudsim-1.2.0/cloudsimd/launchers/cloudsim.py
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "./cloudsim-1.2.0/bin/create_cloudsim.py", line 51, in <module>
        machine = cloudsim.cloudsim_bootstrap(username, tmp_fname.name)
      File "./cloudsim-1.2.0/cloudsimd/launchers/cloudsim.py", line 446, in cloudsim_bootstrap
      File "./cloudsim-1.2.0/cloudsimd/launchers/cloudsim.py", line 249, in launch
launch_utils.launch.LaunchException: timeout while waiting for EC2 machine(s) cloudsim_c6b04475a

It looks like, from the AWS Console, that the machine was created, but never received any tags or other provisioning.

I tried the same command again, about 30 minutes later (after trying to debug the failed launch), and it succeeded.

Perhaps a timeout should be adjusted.
content.html:
I had the following error when trying to launch a new CloudSim machine, using cloudsim-1.2.0 (private details removed from command line):

$ ./cloudsim-1.2.0/bin/create_cloudsim.py <address> <key> <secret-key> <zone>
./cloudsim-1.2.0/inside/cgi-bin
./cloudsim-1.2.0/cloudsimd/launchers
./cloudsim-1.2.0/cloudsimd/launchers/cloudsim.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./cloudsim-1.2.0/bin/create_cloudsim.py", line 51, in <module>
    machine = cloudsim.cloudsim_bootstrap(username, tmp_fname.name)
  File "./cloudsim-1.2.0/cloudsimd/launchers/cloudsim.py", line 446, in cloudsim_bootstrap
  File "./cloudsim-1.2.0/cloudsimd/launchers/cloudsim.py", line 249, in launch

launch_utils.launch.LaunchException: timeout while waiting for EC2 machine(s) cloudsim_c6b04475a

It looks like, from the AWS Console, that the machine was created, but never received any tags or other provisioning.

I tried the same command again, about 30 minutes later (after trying to debug the failed launch), and it succeeded.

Perhaps a timeout should be adjusted.

values.title: Make it easier to do source builds of gazebo / drcsim

content.raw:
In addition to simulator and simulator-prerelease, I would propose a configuration called simulator-sourcebuild. Several of us are currently doing this manually; here are the steps I follow after I ssh in to a launched simulator machine:

Desired parameters:

* GAZEBO_BRANCH (eg. default, gazebo_1.5)
* GAZEBO_CMAKE_OPTIONS (eg. -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release)
* DRCSIM_BRANCH (eg. default, drcsim_2.1)
* DRCSIM_CMAKE_OPTIONS (eg. -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release)
~~~
sudo apt-get install -y mercurial libprotoc-dev libtar-dev libbullet-dev
# Gazebo
hg clone https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo -u  ${GAZEBO_BRANCH}
cd gazebo
mkdir build
cd build
cmake .. -DCMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=/opt/ros/fuerte ${GAZEBO_CMAKE_OPTIONS}
make -j 4
sudo make install
# Drcsim
hg clone https://bitbucket.org/osrf/drcsim -u  ${DRCSIM_BRANCH}
cd ~/drcsim
mkdir build
cd build
cmake .. ${DRCSIM_CMAKE_OPTIONS}
# Then need to set up .bashrc
~~~

Also, the ~/.gazebo/diagnostics directory fills up pretty fast. A trick to avoid that is:
~~~
sudo mkdir /mnt/gazebo-diagnostics
sudo chown ubuntu:ubuntu /mnt/gazebo-diagnostics
mkdir ~/.gazebo
ln -s /mnt/gazebo-diagnostics ~/.gazebo/diagnostics
~~~
content.html:
In addition to simulator and simulator-prerelease, I would propose a configuration called simulator-sourcebuild. Several of us are currently doing this manually; here are the steps I follow after I ssh in to a launched simulator machine:

Desired parameters:

  • GAZEBO_BRANCH (eg. default, gazebo_1.5)
  • GAZEBO_CMAKE_OPTIONS (eg. -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release)
  • DRCSIM_BRANCH (eg. default, drcsim_2.1)
  • DRCSIM_CMAKE_OPTIONS (eg. -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release)
sudo apt-get install -y mercurial libprotoc-dev libtar-dev libbullet-dev
# Gazebo
hg clone https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo -u  ${GAZEBO_BRANCH}
cd gazebo
mkdir build
cd build
cmake .. -DCMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=/opt/ros/fuerte ${GAZEBO_CMAKE_OPTIONS}
make -j 4
sudo make install
# Drcsim
hg clone https://bitbucket.org/osrf/drcsim -u  ${DRCSIM_BRANCH}
cd ~/drcsim
mkdir build
cd build
cmake .. ${DRCSIM_CMAKE_OPTIONS}
# Then need to set up .bashrc

Also, the ~/.gazebo/diagnostics directory fills up pretty fast. A trick to avoid that is:

sudo mkdir /mnt/gazebo-diagnostics
sudo chown ubuntu:ubuntu /mnt/gazebo-diagnostics
mkdir ~/.gazebo
ln -s /mnt/gazebo-diagnostics ~/.gazebo/diagnostics

It seems that two people cannot connect to the field computer via the router at the same time (from two different stations): each time one logs in, the second is logged out (via SSH)

values.title: Setting the latency to 0 does not change the latency

content.raw:
Set latency to 400
Set latency to 0 

The latency keeps at 400.

Setting the latency to 0 should have the same effect as "reset" or show an error message.
The reset button could disappear.

The latency keeps at 400.

content.raw:
Using cloudsim-prerelease-1.3.5 with Chrome, I was following [this tutorial](http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/CloudSim/1.3/start_simulation) and experienced the following sequence of events:

* go to console page
* select "simulator" and press "Launch"; then press "OK"
* nothing seemed to change on the console page (i.e., no machine/constellation added to the Constellations widget)
* open new tab to the same URL, and can see the new machine/constellation starting up as expected
* go back to original tab and notice the presence of an unexpected form titled "Simulation properties, with some text boxes ("ROS Package," "Launch file," etc.)

I believe that the unexpected form was present before I clicked "Launch," but I'm not certain.

Going into the Chrome debugger on the page with the unexpected form, I see this error:

    Uncaught TypeError: Object [object Object] has no method 'dialog' constellations.js:59

Looks like a try/catch needs to be added somewhere.  Perhaps it's a race condition of some sort.
content.html:
Using cloudsim-prerelease-1.3.5 with Chrome, I was following this tutorial and experienced the following sequence of events:

  • go to console page
  • select "simulator" and press "Launch"; then press "OK"
  • nothing seemed to change on the console page (i.e., no machine/constellation added to the Constellations widget)
  • open new tab to the same URL, and can see the new machine/constellation starting up as expected
  • go back to original tab and notice the presence of an unexpected form titled "Simulation properties, with some text boxes ("ROS Package," "Launch file," etc.)

I believe that the unexpected form was present before I clicked "Launch," but I'm not certain.

Going into the Chrome debugger on the page with the unexpected form, I see this error:

Uncaught TypeError: Object [object Object] has no method 'dialog' constellations.js:59

Looks like a try/catch needs to be added somewhere. Perhaps it's a race condition of some sort.

values.title: Latency plot in console needs axis labels, doesn't match actual latency

content.raw: While doing the latency tutorial, I was seeing a match between the target latency I typed into the box, and the ping time in the ssh window. However, the latency plot was off by about 95 ms. I suspect that this plot is showing the artificial delay generated by the router, but it is hard to tell because there are no axis labels. Ideally, this plot would show the round-trip latency, but if that's not possible, it should be labeled to indicate what it actually is measuring.
content.html: While doing the latency tutorial, I was seeing a match between the target latency I typed into the box, and the ping time in the ssh window. However, the latency plot was off by about 95 ms. I suspect that this plot is showing the artificial delay generated by the router, but it is hard to tell because there are no axis labels. Ideally, this plot would show the round-trip latency, but if that's not possible, it should be labeled to indicate what it actually is measuring.

values.title: ROS_MASTER_URI not set on field computer

content.raw:
Using prerelease 1.3.5, `.bashrc` on the Field Computer ends with:

    # CloudSim
    . /usr/share/drcsim/setup.sh
    export DISPLAY=:0 
    export ROS_IP=10.0.0.52
    export GAZEBO_IP=10.0.0.52

Notably absent is a setting for `ROS_MASTER_URI`, which should presumably be `http://10.0.0.51:11311`.
content.html:
Using prerelease 1.3.5, .bashrc on the Field Computer ends with:

# CloudSim
. /usr/share/drcsim/setup.sh
export DISPLAY=:0 
export ROS_IP=10.0.0.52
export GAZEBO_IP=10.0.0.52

Notably absent is a setting for ROS_MASTER_URI, which should presumably be http://10.0.0.51:11311.

values.title: Consider removing tutorials for older versions

content.raw: Participant 5 pointed out that it's probably fine to get rid of old tutorials, since all users must run the most recent version of CloudSim for now.
content.html: Participant 5 pointed out that it's probably fine to get rid of old tutorials, since all users must run the most recent version of CloudSim for now.

values.title: Update Admin tutorial to reflect new Settings layout

content.raw: The tutorial still has the old layout
content.html: The tutorial still has the old layout

values.title: Provide feedback when deleting users as Admin

content.raw: When Participant 5 tried to delete a user, he clicked multiple times and nothing happened. Can we give feedback like: add "Deleting..." in small, light grey text next to the Delete button and leave it there until the user is deleted.
content.html: When Participant 5 tried to delete a user, he clicked multiple times and nothing happened. Can we give feedback like: add "Deleting..." in small, light grey text next to the Delete button and leave it there until the user is deleted.

content.raw:
* Change bits to bytes
* Change Max Time to Time Limit
* Consider limiting the number of characters that can go into a Task title to avoid cumbersome, long titles that make the Tasks section extend off-screen
content.html:
• Change bits to bytes
  • Change Max Time to Time Limit
  • Consider limiting the number of characters that can go into a Task title to avoid cumbersome, long titles that make the Tasks section extend off-screen

values.title: Make Tasks inactive until constellation is running

content.raw: Participant 5 started a task before the trio was up and ready. We should prevent people from doing this to avoid problems. We can grey out the tasks, and provide a tooltip on hover over the Start Task button that says "You can start a Task once the constellation is up and running"
content.html: Participant 5 started a task before the trio was up and ready. We should prevent people from doing this to avoid problems. We can grey out the tasks, and provide a tooltip on hover over the Start Task button that says "You can start a Task once the constellation is up and running"

values.title: Improve process for setting up VPN

content.raw:
Participants 4 and 5 had trouble setting up their VPN connection. This is in part due to the organization of the tutorials, but could also be improved by moving and/or combining the Download Keys buttons in the Console. Consider putting a Get VPN Key button at the constellation level, instead of the Router level. 

Does it make sense to move the other download buttons as well?
content.html:
Participants 4 and 5 had trouble setting up their VPN connection. This is in part due to the organization of the tutorials, but could also be improved by moving and/or combining the Download Keys buttons in the Console. Consider putting a Get VPN Key button at the constellation level, instead of the Router level.

Does it make sense to move the other download buttons as well?

values.title: Add email notification option to Admin panel

content.raw: It would be neat to let an Admin set up email notifications for when machines have been running for longer than X hours. They could add multiple addresses if they want others to receive the notification as well.
content.html: It would be neat to let an Admin set up email notifications for when machines have been running for longer than X hours. They could add multiple addresses if they want others to receive the notification as well.

content.raw:
This will most likely happen after the VRC. We can collect ideas here. 

* consider creating just one graph for latency, with annotations describing that the latency occurs between different machine pairs
* consider laying the machines out as a tree diagram with the Router at the top (participant 5 suggestion)
* shrink the headers down by repositioning some of the information from the headers
* change color scheme
* consider grouping the Tasks with the simulator machine since they are most closely related OR move tasks to the top (needs more discussion)
content.html:
This will most likely happen after the VRC. We can collect ideas here.

  • consider creating just one graph for latency, with annotations describing that the latency occurs between different machine pairs
  • consider laying the machines out as a tree diagram with the Router at the top (participant 5 suggestion)
  • shrink the headers down by repositioning some of the information from the headers
  • change color scheme
  • consider grouping the Tasks with the simulator machine since they are most closely related OR move tasks to the top (needs more discussion)

values.title: Create separate tutorial on selecting the region

content.raw:
Most users have had trouble understanding the regions. We should provide a separate tutorial (not only within the Admin tutorial), that explains regions and walks users through the process of finding the correct one (including a note that this is something only the admin can do). We can reuse the text that's in the Setup tutorial. 

* We can link to this tutorial from the Setup tutorial
content.html:
Most users have had trouble understanding the regions. We should provide a separate tutorial (not only within the Admin tutorial), that explains regions and walks users through the process of finding the correct one (including a note that this is something only the admin can do). We can reuse the text that's in the Setup tutorial.

  • We can link to this tutorial from the Setup tutorial

values.title: Add label to Add User field on Admin page

content.raw: Under the text field for adding a new user/admin's email address, add a small label that says "New User's Gmail Address" to be more clear that an email account is required, and not a name. One user started to enter the user's name, instead of the email address.
content.html: Under the text field for adding a new user/admin's email address, add a small label that says "New User's Gmail Address" to be more clear that an email account is required, and not a name. One user started to enter the user's name, instead of the email address.

values.title: Redirect users to Login page when they Log out

content.raw:
Participant 4 logged out and was not taken where he was expecting to go. Logging out should take users back to the login page

He also mentioned that a "Sign in as a different user" option would be nice to have
content.html:
Participant 4 logged out and was not taken where he was expecting to go. Logging out should take users back to the login page

He also mentioned that a "Sign in as a different user" option would be nice to have

content.raw: P4 was unsure of what happens when he clicks Start on a task. He expected it to queue that Task to run next so that he can queue a bunch of tasks and let them run automatically, in order. Should we do this, or require users to manually click Start when the previous task has completed?
content.html: P4 was unsure of what happens when he clicks Start on a task. He expected it to queue that Task to run next so that he can queue a bunch of tasks and let them run automatically, in order. Should we do this, or require users to manually click Start when the previous task has completed?

values.title: Provide better feedback when machines are launching

content.raw:
Because this process takes quite some time, users in the first round of testing expressed confusion over the state of the machines. The indicator lights for Package and Launch aren't the same, and it's unclear when everything is ready to go.

We should discuss the option of adding "Launching, please wait..." and "Ready" text and perhaps removing one of the indicator lights. Do the users  need to know about the two indicator lights?
content.html:
Because this process takes quite some time, users in the first round of testing expressed confusion over the state of the machines. The indicator lights for Package and Launch aren't the same, and it's unclear when everything is ready to go.

We should discuss the option of adding "Launching, please wait..." and "Ready" text and perhaps removing one of the indicator lights. Do the users need to know about the two indicator lights?

values.title: Add a log to the UI

content.raw: P4 suggested adding an event log to the console, that prints out all significant events. This would be particularly helpful if there are multiple people adding tasks, so that it's clear what the queue looks like. Errors would pop up here as well as notification if something is launching/coming down, etc. "Anything that affects (him)"
content.html: P4 suggested adding an event log to the console, that prints out all significant events. This would be particularly helpful if there are multiple people adding tasks, so that it's clear what the queue looks like. Errors would pop up here as well as notification if something is launching/coming down, etc. "Anything that affects (him)"

values.title: At Setup, prompt users for keys and email address (get rid of launch script)

content.raw:
The email address issue has continued to be confusing for people trying to launch CloudSim. 

Instead of having users string together the keys/email/zone, we'll prompt users for each piece of info one at a time. We can make Zone optional, and provide a tutorial for finding the right zone once they are actually ready to launch the machines. We are currently introducing the Zone concept a bit early, because it's not actually relevant at launch.

Note: we'll continue using the launch script for internal use.
content.html:
The email address issue has continued to be confusing for people trying to launch CloudSim.

Instead of having users string together the keys/email/zone, we'll prompt users for each piece of info one at a time. We can make Zone optional, and provide a tutorial for finding the right zone once they are actually ready to launch the machines. We are currently introducing the Zone concept a bit early, because it's not actually relevant at launch.

Note: we'll continue using the launch script for internal use.

values.title: Create tutorial section about constellation types and diagrams

content.raw:
Because all users can launch a constellation, we should not keep the constellation info only under the Officer section of the tutorials.

We can create a separate tutorial section with diagrams and some text explaining the various constellations. Include links to the rest of the tutorials.
content.html:
Because all users can launch a constellation, we should not keep the constellation info only under the Officer section of the tutorials.

We can create a separate tutorial section with diagrams and some text explaining the various constellations. Include links to the rest of the tutorials.

values.title: Add more feedback when machines are terminated

content.raw: Participant 6 was unsure if the constellation was in fact terminating. If there are errors, we should display an error message. If there are no problems terminating, we should refresh the page more often so that it doesn't take so long for the machines to disappear.
content.html: Participant 6 was unsure if the constellation was in fact terminating. If there are errors, we should display an error message. If there are no problems terminating, we should refresh the page more often so that it doesn't take so long for the machines to disappear.

values.title: Fix text wrapping issue in Console

content.raw:
If the window size is decreased, the text in the Console does not wrap, and instead extends outside of the Console box. 

This also happened when a user entered in a very long Task title.
content.html:
If the window size is decreased, the text in the Console does not wrap, and instead extends outside of the Console box.

This also happened when a user entered in a very long Task title.

values.title: Change wrong Availability Zone error messages

content.raw:
When P6 got an error that he'd used the wrong zone, his first action was to shut down CloudSim completely and try launching again with a different zone. 

We should customize the error messages from AWS so that they direct the user to the correct info. In this case, we should tell them to change the zone under Settings, and provide a link to the proper tutorials.
content.html:
When P6 got an error that he'd used the wrong zone, his first action was to shut down CloudSim completely and try launching again with a different zone.

We should customize the error messages from AWS so that they direct the user to the correct info. In this case, we should tell them to change the zone under Settings, and provide a link to the proper tutorials.

values.title: Clarify/Simplify process for changing availability zone

content.raw:
P6 was unsure if he needed to enter in the keys to change the zone. 

Simple solution: move the explanation text to above the key/zone fields so users read that first. Change to: "Set new AWS credentials and zone. Your keys are required to change the zone. Changes will be applied to new constellations."

More complicated: auto-detect the availability zone OR don't require the keys to change the zone (this will require a minor reorganization of that section of the  UI)

Related to #98
content.html:
P6 was unsure if he needed to enter in the keys to change the zone.

Simple solution: move the explanation text to above the key/zone fields so users read that first. Change to: "Set new AWS credentials and zone. Your keys are required to change the zone. Changes will be applied to new constellations."

More complicated: auto-detect the availability zone OR don't require the keys to change the zone (this will require a minor reorganization of that section of the UI)

Related to #98

values.title: In latency graphs, write out what RTT stands for
